Institution of Special Law on A-bomb Victims Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Institution of Special Law on A-bomb Victims Demanded in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- The Joint Measure Committee for Solving the Issue of A-bomb Victims called a press conference on April 12 at which it demanded the institution of a special law on A-bomb victims, according to south Korean CBS.
 At the conference, Kim Jong Bom, co-representative of the committee, demanded a prompt fundamental measure for the A-bomb victims, accusing the government of turning its face away from the sufferings of them and their descendants.    
 A written request for instituting a special law for the reinstatement of the victims was made public at the conference.

Japan's Apology and Compensation Urged
articles.content:
Japan's Apology and Compensation Urged 
    Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- South Korean women lawmakers, the Council for the Solution of the Issue of the Volunteers' Corps and survivors of the
sexual slavery for the imperial Japanese army reportedly held a press conference inside the building of the south Korean National Assembly on April 18 in demand of Japan's honest apology and compensation for its past crimes.
 They strongly urged the Japanese government to immediately stop its moves to revive militarism and veer to the Right, noting that there is no justification for Japan to make a bid for permanent membership of the UN Security Council unless it reflects on, apologizes and compensates for the crimes the Japanese imperialists committed by reducing Asian women to sexual slaves in the past.

Kim Il Sung's Famous Work Published in Booklet in Venezuela
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Famous Work Published in Booklet in Venezuela
    Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung's famous work "For a Free and Peaceful New World" was published in booklet by the Cantaclara
Publishing House of Venezuela on April 12.
 The work is his speech at the opening session of the 85th Conference of the Inter-Parliamentary Union held in Pyongyang on April 29, Juche 80 (1991).    
 The President in the work elaborated on the tasks and ways for building a free and peaceful new world including the matter of destroying unequal old international orders and setting up fair new international orders in all spheres, political, economic and cultural, and the matter of realizing disarmament and removing such mass destruction weapons as nuclear weapons.

Congratulations to Vatican
articles.content:
Congratulations to Vatican
    Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- Samuel Jang Jae On, chairman of the Central Committee of the Korean Catholics Association, sent a congratulatory message to the Vatican on April 22.
 Extending congratulations to His Eminence Cardinal Joseph Ratzinger for having been elected to the 265th Pope by the grace of the Lord and the firm confidence of the Catholic Church, he in the message prayed His Holiness Pope Benedict XVI as the Supreme Minister of the church to realize love, peace and justice.

articles.title: Congratulations to Kim Jong Il from Foreign Diplomats
articles.content:
Congratulations to Kim Jong Il from Foreign Diplomats
    Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il received a floral basket and a congratulatory letter from the Military Attaches Corps here and a
congratulatory letter from the Economic and Commercial Councilors' Corps on the occasion of the 73rd birthday of the heroic Korean People's Army.
 The floral basket and letters were separately conveyed to officials concerned today by Military Attache of the Iranian embassy Abdullah Hamidi Benam, who is doyen of the military attaches corps, and Commercial Councilor of the Cuban embassy Evelio Duenas Ponce, who is doyen of the councilors' corps.
